entities.name: YEAST
entities.description: Yeast is a type of fungus that plays a key role in the fermentation process of bread baking, producing carbon dioxide and alcohol, which contribute to the bread's texture and flavor

entities.name: FLOUR
entities.description: Flour is a key ingredient in bread baking, made up of proteins called gluten, which give bread its structure and elasticity

entities.name: GLUTEN
entities.description: Gluten is a protein found in flour that forms a network when mixed with water, trapping carbon dioxide and giving bread its structure and elasticity

entities.name: DOUGH
entities.description: Dough is the mixture of flour, water, yeast, and salt that undergoes fermentation and baking to become bread

entities.name: BREAD
entities.description: Bread is a staple food made from a mixture of flour, water, yeast, and salt, which is baked to create a complex and delicious product

entities.name: FERMENTATION
entities.description: Fermentation is the process where yeast feeds on sugars in flour, producing carbon dioxide and alcohol, which contribute to the bread's texture and flavor

entities.name: KNEADING
entities.description: Kneading is the process of stretching and strengthening gluten strands in dough, which is crucial for the bread's structure and texture

entities.name: BAKING
entities.description: Baking is the process of cooking bread in an oven, involving the interaction of heat with the ingredients to set the structure, create a crust, and develop flavors

entities.name: MAILLARD REACTION
entities.description: The Maillard reaction is a chemical process that occurs during baking, where proteins and sugars react at high temperatures to create a brown crust and complex flavors

entities.name: SALT
entities.description: Salt is a key ingredient in bread baking, enhancing flavor and controlling yeast activity

entities.name: CARBON DIOXIDE
entities.description: Carbon dioxide is a gas produced by yeast during fermentation, causing the dough to rise and creating the bread's airy texture

entities.name: ALCOHOL
entities.description: Alcohol is a byproduct of yeast fermentation, contributing to the flavor development of the bread

entities.name: STARCHES
entities.description: Starches in flour gelatinize during baking, setting the structure of the bread and contributing to its texture

entities.name: HEAT
entities.description: Heat is a critical factor in the baking process, activating yeast, setting the structure of the bread, and causing the Maillard reaction

entities.name: TEMPERATURE
entities.description: Temperature is an important factor in the baking process, affecting the rise and even baking of the bread

entities.name: HUMIDITY
entities.description: Humidity in the oven helps create a crisp crust and a moist interior in the bread
